comments.raw_text:
aceman .. . you want to save the world, & i don't have time for this.

your replies are totally indirect & not addressing my issue.

1) i disabled compatibility check to have the latest nightly & my addons
& don't wish to get rid of my addons, i'm not seeking regression but progression
& a fix.

2) i'm not here to disable userchromejs 1.4 but to make nightly recognize
that code i added that is supposed to work with that addon. unless you
have a workaround that does the same.

3) either i .. . "Amuse" myself in disabling or enabling addons, 
those errors will surely cease in the end, & i'll have no addons
at all or just 4 instead of 15 or more. I can even remove the skin,
or always open nightly in safe mode, to make sure i get no errors,
will it fix my issue ? the answer: Not at all. & it 'll even get rid
of a lot of functionalities.

4) Trying to get focused on the issue & not how all other addons
function or trying to find a workaround is more accessible than
obtaining compatible fixes for all the running addons in my ff
release. which is why your approach is aimless in the meantime
& out of subject. you worry about other addons while i don't want
to run nightly naked, & i'm worried about one addon & it's functionality.

comments.raw_text:
OK, what would move us forward is if you contact the author of userchromejs, point him to this report and ask him to comment here what his extension tries to do (with your code snippet) and what is the problem in Firefox 9, what has changed in his opinion.

Otherwise at this stage we can't do anything, we can't know each extension.

I have installed the extension and added your code (you forgot the closing '}') to <profile>/chrome/userchrome.js and it does not resize my window at startup. I do not see any relevant error in Error console. The extension doesn't even have serious documentation where I should put the code.

A sort of pecuniary attitude .. . >>

"Sent: 26 minutes ago
From: zeniko:

For your information: I'm not the author of the userChromeJS extension, alta88 is (I've just written the predecessor extension for Firefox 3.*: userChrome.js).

Also, in case you're "lola" in that bug report: Please be more patient with aceman. You're using an instable development build of Firefox with an extension that hasn't been marked as compatible. If you need help for fixing this mess, not being willing to assist and provide answers is considered rude.

Good luck in figuring out this issue."

comments.text:
Well, it seems I cannot reproduce it on linux, only on Win XP. On that machine I cannot do regression testing.

And there seems to be a bug in the extension. Even when I comment out the script in chrome/userchrome.js , it still does execute. Or when I update it, it does not pick up the new code. I found out an old cached copy of it is executing from startupcache/startupcache.4.little . When I delete the file, the script does update.

Can you try that, lola?
comments.author: acelists@atlas.sk
comments.raw_text:
Well, it seems I cannot reproduce it on linux, only on Win XP. On that machine I cannot do regression testing.

I found out an old cached copy of it is executing from startupcache/startupcache.4.little . When I delete the file, the script does update.

Can you try that, lola?

comments.raw_text:
I am not sure why we talk about Thunderbird now, all my comments were about Firefox nightlies. However, you can find out which profile you are really using by starting the program and going to Help -> Troubleshooting information and the Open folder.

Or you can also delete the file in all profiles, it doesn't matter, the program will create them anew where needed.
